title: Conclusion Of The Crossing Roads
opening: On the streets of the Imperial capital, Alliance forces crush Edelgard's army and take up the perimeter of the Imperial palace. The time has come to face Emperor Edelgard and to free Rhea from her clutches.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Is everyone ready? The objective of this battle is to defeat Edelgard and rescue Rhea. According to the information Dedue gave us, the throne room is directly north of the castle's main entrance. It's safe to assume that's where Edelgard is.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I don't want to kill Edelgard.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Is there no way to walk the same path as Edelgard?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: She's a fellow student to all of us. If there's a path that we can walk together, that would be preferable. But that all depends on Edelgard. If she won't yield, then that's that. If showing pity would put my allies in danger, I will not hesitate to kill her. I ask that you and everyone here prepare yourselves to do the same.

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: Understood. I think I speak for everyone when I say that we are prepared.

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: The future of the Alliance – no, of Fódlan – is at stake. I have been prepared for this my whole life.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Captain Jeralt taught me that indecisiveness is a weakness. One must cast aside their doubts before fighting.

intro.speaker: Flayn
intro.line: The lives of Lady Rhea and everyone here are more important than all else. I shall be prepared.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: You know what? I wouldn't be surprised if she took one look at my overstuffed muscles and surrendered in tears, then and there!

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: I really hope that Edelgard will yield...

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Edelgard is a stubborn one. I don't think she's likely to surrender.

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: I...I'll fight with all I got to save Lady Rhea!

intro.speaker: Seteth
intro.line: Rescuing Lady Rhea is my dearest wish. We must prevail, no matter what it takes.

intro.speaker: Alois
intro.line: In the name of the Knights of Seiros, we'll bring the hammer down on the Imperial army!

intro.speaker: Judith
intro.line: Satisfied yet, boy? Everyone made up their minds a long time ago.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: OK. Let's get started. We're yours to command, my friend.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Everyone, take your positions! The battle is upon us!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: They've made it into the palace, but it's actually the perfect chance to turn the tables on them. Defeating them all will turn the tide of war instantly. Taking a risk on dragging us back from the brink is the only option. Everyone! Prepare for a bitter struggle! Victory to the Adrestian Empire!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: There are more enemies inside the palace than I thought. It's gonna take a lot to bring this situation under control. But, if we defeat Edelgard, then victory is ours! Everyone, let's go!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Our bashful little emperor has locked herself up behind the door of the throne room. The key should be around here somewhere. We need to find whoever's got it and take them out.

battle.speaker: Petra
battle.line: We must be protecting the throne room! You will not be getting past!

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: Stay back! I'll protect Edie with my life!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: We'll have to take out one of them if we're going to advance... Petra seems like the shortest route...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: I wonder how Dedue is doing... I hope I get to see him again.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: I must confess I never imagined that you would be able to pursue me this far. I don't mean to belittle your skills, Professor, but you've far surpassed my expectations. Inform the troops! Destroy anyone who sets foot in the throne room!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: We should be able to get through to the throne room now...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: This should give us a bit more freedom of movement. Now, how best to attack...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: We did it! The enemy won't be able to send any more reinforcements now.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Clever tactic. It's going to be difficult to turn the tables now.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: I cannot vanquish her alone. So I will join you in this battle. But if I fall, leave me. My only wish is for Edelgard's head.

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: So you're another of the goddess's vanguard. You don't have a shred of self-awareness, do you? Come at me, so that I may put you out of your misery!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Professor... I suppose you think you can defeat me. Is that right? But I will never give up. Even if my arms and legs failed me, I would still find a way to move forward. I will smash that false goddess and her minion into the ground! I will fight to free this world from her vile grasp!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: This has nothing do to with where you were born. That we are fighting now is only a result of the choices you've made. So I'm going to give that the response it deserves. I will crush you with everything I have!

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Edelgard, give up! We don't want to kill you!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: But... I must kill you. If I don't, the righteous world I dream of will never see the light. Come at me with everything you have. For one of us, this is the end!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Your ideals, I understand they're not so far removed from my own. But without sufficient knowledge of this land's suffering, I can't entrust Fódlan to you!

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Perhaps. I daresay it's true that I don't fully understand the history of Fódlan. Still, I've seen many things in my life. Don't worry. I'll finish the job for you.

boss.speaker: Flayn
boss.line: Edelgard! Please! Release Rhea... Release Fódlan!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: If you strike me down, they will return. I cannot permit what you desire. You are a child of the goddess. You must not be allowed power over the people!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Lysithea. You and I are so alike. We could have walked the same path.

boss.speaker: Lysithea
boss.line: We're alike? You don't mean to tell me... It can't be!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Yet now, we are at a crossroads. There's no turning back. Must we fight each other for the things we believe in?

boss.speaker: Lysithea
boss.line: That's exactly what's going to happen. And I will defeat you, Edelgard.

boss.speaker: Seteth
boss.line: Edelgard! Return Rhea! Release your grip on Fódlan!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: If you strike me down, they will return. I cannot permit what you desire. You are a child of the goddess. You must not be allowed power over the people!

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: It looks as though... my path... will end here.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: Even now... across this land, people are killing each other. If you do not act now, this conflict... will go on forever.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: Your path... lies across my grave. It is time for you to find the courage to walk it.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: If I must fall... let it be by your hand.

cutscene.speaker: Edelgard
cutscene.line: I wanted... to walk with you...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: It's over. We were only able to beat her because of you.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: This wasn't the conclusion I had hoped for. Even though... I... Never mind. It's over now. The important thing is that we won.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Here, boy. A letter. An Imperial general asked me to give it to you.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: A letter? Let's see it.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: It looks like it's from... Hubert. Edelgard's vassal.

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: If you are reading this letter, that means I have perished. As Her Majesty would never surrender to another, I can only assume she has fallen as well. It greatly pains me to think of this coming to pass... That said, as the survivors, I must ask you to settle certain affairs in our stead. You must destroy the threat that slithers in the dark. I am sure you must recall Monica and Tomas. Their allies yet live. They hold deep resentment against the children of the goddess and the people of the world, and they are biding their time until they can exact revenge. If left to their own devices, it is certain they will eventually bring unimaginable calamity and suffering to the world. I detected their sorcery when you took Fort Merceus. I have deduced the location of their stronghold, Shambhala. You will find its whereabouts enclosed. There is no question that they are the enemies of everyone in Fódlan. Do not allow yourselves to forget that. Lastly... While I cannot say she is in good health, the archbishop resides in a secret chamber in the Imperial palace. I have shared the location of the entrance to that secret chamber with the person to whom I have entrusted this letter. I believe that Her Majesty will be victorious... Even still, I must plan for her defeat as well. If you wish to lead this world, I challenge you to rise to the occasion and surpass my estimation of you. Such is your obligation as the victors... and the only fitting tribute to all that Lady Edelgard sacrificed.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hubert... To leave a letter like this behind... You were a better man than I believed you to be. So, Rhea is alive. And the fight isn't over yet. Those who slither in the dark... It sounds like Fódlan will never know peace unless we defeat them.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: The allies of Monica and Tomas... Well, we knew about them already. I think it's safe to assume this is the same group who used Lysithea for their blood experiments. And they were also responsible for the javelins of light that destroyed the fortress. But who are these children of the goddess, who they supposedly resent? There's just not enough information here. I don't suppose there's any chance of his idea of a prank... If so, wow. Good one. Hubert... Rather than writing a letter, you should have just told us before we fought...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Let's ask Rhea about it.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Right. We still don't know for sure if this letter is telling the truth. Let's go find out.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: You... You have come to save me... Is this... Is this a dream? I have longed to see you again... all this time... Is it truly you?

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Claude... I can see you have grown into a reliable young man... Thank you for supporting the professor, and for rescuing me. Surely the protection of the goddess has-

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Wait, Rhea. What do you know about the children of the goddess?

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Children of... What is this about?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Forgive my bluntness. Someone from the Empire filled us in on a few things. I know it must be painful for us to ask you difficult questions after such an arduous confinement. But we have no choice. We must defeat a secret enemy... Those who slither in the dark. Do you know about them?

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Those who slither in the dark...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Apparently, they resent the children of the goddess and the people of the world, and are planning something big. Something terrible.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: They use blood for their wicked magic and are capable of dropping javelins of light from the sky, which are powerful enough to crush a fortress. If you can think of anything at all, please tell us now. We need to know as much as possible about these enemies in order to stop them.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: This is the critical moment that will determine whether or not Fódlan falls! Can't you see that the time for secrets has passed?!

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: It is true that there is a group of people who have slithered in the darkness and threatened the peace of Fódlan since ancient times. I am sure you have heard the stories of a man named Nemesis...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The King of Liberation...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The wielder of the Sword of the Creator...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Nemesis, the King of Liberation. He's the hero to whom the goddess gave the Sword of the Creator.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: Nemesis was originally the leader of a group of bandits. He plundered the Holy Tomb and stole the remains of the progenitor god. When Nemesis appeared in Zanado some time later, he already wielded the Sword of the Creator.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: In Zanado?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Zanado, the Red Canyon...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: How did he get the Sword of the Creator?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: According to legend, the goddess gifted him the sword to fight against the evil gods.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: I do not know how Nemesis obtained the sword, or why he appeared in Zanado. But he used that sword to massacre the people there. The children of the progenitor god. From their corpses he gained even more power, and brought war to Fódlan...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: That's completely different from what the legends tell us about Nemesis.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: A mere bandit like Nemesis would not have been capable of anything so monstrous on his own...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Aha! So Nemesis had accomplices. And those accomplices must have been those who slither in the dark. They used Nemesis! And this time they used the Imperial army to once again bring war to Fódlan! I finally get it... And I even understand why Edelgard was associating with them. Just as they were trying to use the Empire, the Empire was trying to use them. Rhea, there's still a mountain of things I need to ask you. And I will. But I'll leave all of that for another day. You must be weak after living in confinement for so long. Please rest for a while. My friend... Let's prepare for battle. We need to strike Shambhala as soon as possible.

end.speaker: Rhea
end.line: You must not allow Fódlan's bloody history... the Red Canyon Tragedy... to repeat itself...

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Hm. It occurred to me that we never got an answer from Rhea about the children of the goddess.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Aren't they the people of Zanado?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: She did say that the people of the Red Canyon were the children of the progenitor god, so I suppose so. But those evil guys continue to plot their revenge even after the Red Canyon Tragedy. Does that mean some of the children of the goddess, or their descendants, are still alive?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Rhea?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Could be. She was talking about what happened in Zanado as if she was there herself.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Flayn?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: If there's something special about her blood, we can't rule out the possibility.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Me?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Huh. Maybe? Though I get the feeling you're something else altogether.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: What are these children anyway? And how are they connected to the goddess? Bah! I almost disappeared into the bottomless swamp that is my mind. I thought that after we defeated the Empire, I'd be able to see that sight I long to see..

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: What sight is that?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: I've told you about my dreams before... I want to break down the wall separating Fódlan from the outside world. The sight I want to see lies beyond that. Honestly, it's a trivial thing to fixate on. Just people, gathered in their towns. Living our their lives together. Sometimes laughing. Sometimes fighting. But the people living there aren't just citizens of Fódlan. They are people from Dagda, Brigid, and even Duscur and Sreng. There could be people who were born in Almyra or countries even farther east there too.. All of those people living together, like it's nothing special at all. That's the sight I long to see. It's so simple, but still so far away... But this is no time for complaining. We need to focus on capturing Shambhala. Let's hurry up and gather everyone together.

dialogue.speaker: Judith
dialogue.line: So... you mean to tell me that Fódlan will fall to ruin if we leave those guys be?

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Um, if this map is reliable, their base is just south of my family's territory.

dialogue.speaker: Lorenz
dialogue.line: This story is a bit much to believe... And yet...

dialogue.speaker: Leonie
dialogue.line: It does ring true somehow.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Remember Monica, the one who killed Jeralt? And the old man who was masquerading as Tomas? They were their allies. And the Flame Emperor and the Death Knight were merely their pawns.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: The people who were after my blood?!

dialogue.speaker: Lysithea
dialogue.line: They were also the ones who used me to conduct their blood experiments...

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: As awful as it sounds, they're seemingly fond of using blood in their secret techniques.

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Eww! That's really gross! I could never be friends with someone like that.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: I believe they were also responsible for the javelin of light that destroyed Fort Merceus.

dialogue.speaker: Judith
dialogue.line: Hold up, boy. Do you really think that we can win against such powerful foes?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: I don't know. But we have to try, don't we?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: This is for Fódlan's future.

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: We've really taken on something big. I wonder if our names will go down in history.

dialogue.speaker: Lorenz
dialogue.line: My heroic name? Passed down to future generations? Haha! A worthy cause indeed.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: It's our responsibility as the victors.

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Since Edelgard can't do it, I guess it falls to us.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: They were trying to use the Imperial army to plunge Fódlan into war, but we nipped that in the bud. Now we just need to tear our their roots. And I know we have what it takes to do it.
